unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Name the Test
question_text: Five situations ready for significance testing are presented. Assume all people are randomly selected. Which one describes a potential $t$-test for slope?

choices.text: A pollster asks $30$ men and $30$ women whether they plan to vote for a certain candidate.
A pollster asks $60$ people how many times they voted in the past and how old they are.
A pollster asks $60$ people their race, their political party, and their religion.
A pollster asks $60$ people how many times they have voted in the past.
A pollster asks $30$ men and $30$ women how many years of school they attended.

solution:
Solution

A $t$-test for slope uses linear regression to estimate the slope between two variables. Both variables should be quantitative in nature. Whether or not the $y$ variable is consistently responding to an $x$ variable can be shown in part through the value of the slope. A regression equation is calculated from the data and is used to predict values for one variable based on the other. The $t$-test then tests to see how sure we are of a possible association between the two variables.

In this problem, the answer asks people how old they are and how many times they voted in the past. Both variables are quantitative. While the predictive aspect might work in either direction, it is likely that the two numbers may well be associated.

So, Choice 'B' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because there are two sampling groups and they are being asked a yes or no question. Thus, this is a two-sample test for a difference of proportions (or possibly a chi-square test for homogeneity).

Choice 'C' is incorrect because a group of people are being asked $3$ questions with qualitative answers. Thus, this is a chi-square test for independence.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because a group of people are being asked one question that is quantitative. Thus, this is a one-sample test for means.

Choice 'E' is incorrect because there are two sampling groups and they are being asked one questions that is quantitative. Thus, this is a two-sample test for a difference of means.
